question: In the reaction:
<katex>$$C_{6}H_{5}CN \xrightarrow[(ii)H_{3}O^{+}]{(i)SnCl_{2}+HCl} X \xrightarrow{conc. KOH} Y + Z$$</katex>
Formation of X, formation of Y and Z are known by
explanation: 1. The conversion of Nitrile (<katex>$C_6H_5CN$</katex>) to Aldehyde (<katex>$C_6H_5CHO$</katex>, X) using <katex>$SnCl_2 + HCl$</katex> is known as the **Stephen reaction**.
2. The reaction of Benzaldehyde (X) (which lacks alpha-hydrogens) with concentrated KOH to form an alcohol and a salt of carboxylic acid (Y + Z) is known as the **Cannizzaro reaction**.
